projects.name: Green Society
projects.description: Green Society is one of Canada's leading online dispensary for cannabis products. I was given the opportunity to design various things for the business. These include: Logo Design, Stand Up Pouch Bags, Rolling Papers, Match Boxes, T-Shirt Designs, and Web Banners.

projects.name: The Collective Coffee Roasters & Bar
projects.description: The Collective Coffee Roasters & Bar is a fictional coffee shop located at the heart of Gastown, Vancouver. With a strong passion for coffee, The Collective strives to provide the best coffee experience tailored to your tastes.

projects.name: Typography Posters
projects.description: We were given an assignment for our MDIA 3165 - Vector Graphics class to create two Swiss-styled typographic posters with the supplied text for The Proms Classical Music Festival. Each poster uses a different type treatment: Poster 1 - Sans-serif, Poster 2 - Serif Typeface. The goal of this assignment was to understand the hierarchy of text and how a viewer will be able to easily navigate through the content of the poster. In addition, the technical requirements of this assignment was to create a modular grid to structure the layout, use of global swatches, and paragraph styles associated all text.

projects.name: Dream Animation
projects.description: For the midterm project in our MDIA 3187 - Visual Effects class, we were asked to pick a topic and create an animation that showcases our understanding and application of using keyframes, animation curves, expressions, nested compositions, shape layers and masking. After coming up with a topic, we had to storyboard our animation before executing it in Adobe After Effects. All vectors used inside the animation were created in Adobe Illustrator and imported over.

projects.name: Snapchat Graph Animation
projects.description: We were given an assignment for our MDIA 3187 - Visual Effects class to find an image of a graph online and create an animation to present the data in a more visually appealing way. The following animation uses expressions, shape layers, trim paths, and number effects to create the desired result.

projects.name: Product Illustration
projects.description: We were given an assignment for our MDIA 3165 - Vector Graphics class to create a coloured illustration of a mechanical object of our choice. The purpose of this assignment was to apply the skills we learned to recreate an object based off of a photograph. This illustration demonstrates the usage of basic shapes, pen tool, transformation functions, pathfinder functions, and most importantly, global swatches. All objects and any gradients created for the illustration must have a global swatch applied to them.
